result.execSummary:
The defendant Melany D. DeHaven was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Narcotic Drugs [Modifiers: Second and Subsequent Offense], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(am).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent with: all felony and misd. cts.

miscConds.notes: GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof.
AODA & any follow up as recommended.
AODA & any follow up as recommended.

Absolute sobriety- submit for testing as required by PO.
No contact with co-defendants as follows K.W., G.C., J.B., J.G., & N.E.
Contact allowed for by PO with P.M.

Assessment, treatment, and counseling as deemed appropriate by PO.
One DNA sample for all cases.
Credit for 10 days.

If probation is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  

A copy of the police report has been faxed to the probation office.

COURT ORDERS: 
On Felony counts - Sentence W/held - 4 Years Probation on each count, concurrent to each other and to Misd counts
On Misd count - Sentence W/held - 1 year Probation, concurrent to each other and to Felony counts
CONDITIONS: in 14CF115 - Ct. 3 only--6 months MCJ I&S any portion of which to be used for rule violations; 80 hours c.s. total; Any assessment/treatment/counseling as deemed appropriate by PO; CC including one DNA surcharge on each of 3 cases, and one DNA sample; Maintain absolute sobriety and submit for testing as required by PO; GFE to obtain/maintain FTE/FT schooling or combination thereof; AODA and any follow up as recommended; N/C with co-defendants as follows: Kayla Weiks, Gino Chiarello, Jennifer Burnett, Joseph Glenetski, Natasha Eldrige; Contact as allowed for by PO with Phillip McClure.

Credit if revoked, credit as follows: 14CF115-2 days; 14CF632-10 days; 17 days of time served in 14CF693 are credited to 14CF288
